[SEC] 1. Introduction.[SUBSEC] 1.1 Purpose: The Blit Draft system defines requirements to enhance laboratory operations, streamline data management, and ensure compliance with HIPAA and FDA standards.
[SEC] 1. Introduction.[SUBSEC] 1.2 Scope: Blit Draft enables secure sample tracking, report generation, and regulatory compliance in laboratory workflows.

[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.1 System Interfaces: Blit Draft integrates with legacy LIS modules, authentication services, and external databases.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.2 User Interfaces: Blit Draft provides intuitive dashboards for laboratory staff and administrators.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.3 Hardware Interfaces: Blit Draft operates on laboratory workstations, mobile devices, and cloud servers.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.4 Software Interfaces: Blit Draft supports APIs for data exchange with laboratory instruments and regulatory platforms.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.5 Communications Interfa: Blit Draft uses encrypted HTTPS protocols for secure data transmission.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.6 Memory Constraints: Blit Draft optimizes memory usage for large dataset processing and secure storage.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.7 Operations: Blit Draft ensures 24/7 availability with automated maintenance and failover support.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.8 Site Adaptation Requir: Blit Draft configures for diverse laboratory environments and regulatory requirements.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.9 Interfaces with Servic: Blit Draft connects to compliance registries for audit logging and verification.

[SEC] 1. Introduction.[SUBSEC] 1.4 Product Functions: Blit Draft supports data entry, sample tracking, reporting, and secure compliance auditing.
[SEC] 1. Introduction.[SUBSEC] 1.5 User Characteristics: Designed for laboratory personnel and administrators with basic to advanced technical expertise.
[SEC] 1. Introduction.[SUBSEC] 1.6 Limitations: Blit Draft relies on compliant infrastructure, stable network connectivity, and secure authentication services.
[SEC] 1. Introduction.[SUBSEC] 1.7 Assumptions and Dependencie: Blit Draft requires integration with LIS systems, third-party databases, and regulatory compliance tools.
[SUBSEC] 1.8 Definitions: Sample: A biological or chemical specimen processed and analyzed in laboratory workflows.
[SUBSEC] 1.9 Acronyms and Abbreviations: HIPAA: Health Insurance Portability and Accountability Act

[SUBSEC] 2.1 External Interfaces.REQ-INTF-001: The system shall integrate with Active Directory for user authentication.
[SUBSEC] 2.1 External Interfaces.REQ-INTF-002: The system shall connect to third-party laboratory devices for data exchange.

[SUBSEC] 2.2 Functions.REQ-FUNC-001: The system shall enable administrators to manage user accounts (REQ-DB-001).
[SUBSEC] 2.2 Functions.REQ-FUNC-002: The system shall track samples and generate reports (REQ-DB-002).

[SUBSEC] 2.3 Usability Requirements.REQ-USAB-001: The system shall provide customizable dashboards for workflows.
[SUBSEC] 2.3 Usability Requirements.REQ-USAB-002: The system shall support multilingual functionality.

[SUBSEC] 2.4 Performance Requirements.REQ-PERF-001: The system shall process sample updates within 2 seconds.
[SUBSEC] 2.4 Performance Requirements.REQ-PERF-002: The system shall support 5,000 concurrent users.

[SUBSEC] 2.5 Logical Database Requiremen.REQ-DB-001: The system shall securely store user and sample data (REQ-USAB-001, REQ-USAB-002).
[SUBSEC] 2.5 Logical Database Requiremen.REQ-DB-002: The database shall maintain logs for tracking and auditing.

[SUBSEC] 2.6 Design Constraints.REQ-DSGN-001: The system shall follow modular architecture principles and comply with HIPAA and FDA guidelines.

[SUBSEC] 2.7 Standards Compliance.REQ-COMP-001: The system shall adhere to HIPAA for data privacy.
[SUBSEC] 2.7 Standards Compliance.REQ-COMP-002: The system shall meet FDA standards for laboratory operations.

[SUBSEC] 2.8 Software System Attributes.REQ-ATTR-001: The system shall scale for additional users and log critical activities for auditing.

[SEC] 3. Verification: Functional validation, performance benchmarks, and compliance testing with HIPAA and FDA standards.
[SEC] 4. Supporting Information: User manuals, training guides, and setup documentation.
[SEC] 5. References: HIPAA and FDA guidelines, and laboratory integration manuals.
